intro: Silene correvonianus, commonly known as the Correvonian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the island of Corvo in the Azores. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and rarity, it is considered an endangered species.
